newsitem.title: USA: Alkermes drug agent trial falls short, stock plunges.
newsitem.headline: Alkermes drug agent trial falls short, stock plunges.

text.p: Alkermes Inc. said Monday its drug delivery agent failed to perform as well as expected in a trial, causing the biotechnology firm's stock to lose more than 30 percent of its value.
The stock fell $6.25 to $14 on Nasdaq, where it was among the most-active issues.

Alkermes' drug delivery agent RMP-7 was designed to open the blood-brain barrier, which is tough to penetrate, so that drugs administered afterward may reach the brain to treat recurrent, malignant brain tumours.
The Cambridge, Mass.-based company said RMP-7 failed to achieve its objectives in the third Phase II trial of the agent. Alkermes previously did two successful Phase II trials of the agent in Europe.
If the third trial had been successful, Alkermes said it would have gone straight to the Food and Drug Administration for approval, bypassing Phase III trials.
However, Alkermes said it will now conduct Phase III clinical trials of the agent.
